intro: Sisymbrium filiforme, commonly known as narrowleaf mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in small, yellow flowers. The plant produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium filiforme is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
